Mr. Darwin has <s>pointed out<\s> stated, that when in
various parts of South America he met with
laminated and foliated rocks either alternating with or
near to one another, the cleavage & foliation were
generally parallel & from this circumstance, and
an
occasional tendency in stratified Slates to exhibit
an incipient mineralogical change along the
planes of their cleavage he infers “that foliation
& cleavage are parts of the same process: in cleavage
there being only an incipient separation of the constituent
minerals; in foliation a much more complete
separation & crystallization.”**
